title: U.S. intelligence office to investigate lagging procurement of commercial satellite data
summary: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence is seeking information from the private sector on barriers encountered by commercial remote sensing data providers when doing business with the intelligence community and the Department of Defense.

title: Sidus Space acquires Exo-Space
summary: Sidus acquired Pasadena, California-based Exo-Space to expand its “talent, technology and total addressable market,” said Carol Craig, Sidus founder and CEO.

title: Umbra selected to demonstrate space-based radar to track moving targets
summary: The U.S. Air Force awarded Umbra a $1.25 million contract to demonstrate the capabilities of space-based radar sensors to track moving targets on the ground.

title: NASA clears Crew-7 mission for launch to the space station
summary: NASA and SpaceX are moving ahead with the launch of a seventh crew rotation mission to the International Space Station this week, remaining vigilant about crewed launches even as they become more routine.

title: Luna-25’s Engines Fired Longer Than Planned
summary: The head of the Russian space agency said today that Luna-25 crashed into the Moon because the spacecraft’s engine fired longer than planned. The trouble began on Saturday when Luna-25 […]
